content: this legal text summarizes a case that occurred in ghent on january 23rd 2020 the court of appeal upheld decisions regarding time limits for notarial activities in a divorce proceeding and subsequent division of assets despite extensions granted to one party their failure to comply obstructed the proceedings the court emphasized the importance of following procedural requirements outlined in the judicial code for fair and timely proceedings the appeal was unsuccessful confirming the previous judgment and highlighting the responsibility to uphold timely legal processes the case involved issues of liquidation distribution division of assets and defense claims the full judgment is available on jurisquare
